ellenosborne.comment: Having seen unanimous agreement from my fellow board members, I am confident in supporting this measure. It's clear we all share a commitment to moving forward with this policy change.

grahampaige.comment:
Yes. We now have seven yeses and two abstentions. So motion passes. Motion carried. Our next item is the future agenda items and sharing by the board.  Are there any other things that any of our board members would like to put into this list? Yes, Dr. Acuff. I wanted to talk with Mr. Page about the meeting schedule for the rest of the year. He indicated that he was going to work with me after winter break to look at having more opportunities for meetings to discuss the second semester reopening strategies. But given what happened tonight, and I appreciate everyone being flexible enough to make adjustments to address this unexpected situation. However, I just don't know whether, because of the unknowns that were discussed earlier in terms of how many kids will come back, et cetera, how we're gonna roll out everything with COVID tests and vaccinations, et cetera. Is there any way that we could revisit looking at additional meeting dates prior to spring break? Because the next time we meet, February 11th will be kind of past the window where some of those decisions may be made? Or, for example, during the next week and a half, can staff start working with us through email updates so that they get sent out? You know, every Friday or something until January 22nd, which means we'll have that data for sure when we come together, but we won't lose too much time waiting. What are people thinking? Dave?
katrinacallsen: I agree with Dave's request. My question is, could we schedule these meetings such that perhaps the last hour of each meeting is open to the public? Maybe there's another committee meeting scheduled during that particular evening. That gives both Dr. Haas the flexibility, and I realize there's a lot of logistics here, maybe there's only three new meetings added to this calendar. If that might happen between now and the end of April. Then also consider scheduling a couple of town hall sessions as well around spring break and towards the very beginning of May. Just some suggestions based on some feedback from some folks I've
